pr_title: Safer workflow for getting rows from CassandraKvs

timeline.bodyText:
this is drafts, but I would put in normal review, I'll leave the other stuff out since you have todos on that.
To make tests a bit more readable, we typically get rid of the cruft by way of static functions e.g.
private static Cell createCell(String row, String column) { ... }
since the PtBytes.toBytes is not important and is just cruft
timeline.author: felixdesouza

timeline.bodyText: do you want a containsOnly? that verifies you're skipping stuff?
timeline.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: if I've understood correctly this should verify that the rows don't contain old timestamps?
replies.author: felixdesouza

timeline.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: if it's alright to put it into one, then I think the latter style works quite nicely i.e. single multimap with valueWithTimestamps method.
replies.author: felixdesouza

timeline.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: or better still, in order to not have to scroll up to figure out what row1 means, just use CELL.getRowName, or have the signature be Iterable<byte[]> rowNames(Cell... cells)
replies.author: felixdesouza

timeline.bodyText: what happens when this is null? how does it behave?
timeline.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText:
should it fallback to what it was doing before?
how about this method return the KeyPredicate, so any null handling you have to do is within a function, if absolutely have to do any null handling.
replies.author: felixdesouza

timeline.bodyText: the deletion at this point isn't really important, in your test you have no deletion code anyway (not that I'm asking you to do so either), should name this along the lines of "testGetRowsDoesNotReadOldData" or something along those lines
timeline.author: felixdesouza

timeline.bodyText: this feels oddly similar to translateRowsToKeyPredicates
timeline.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: perhaps instead of mutating the query, how about just setting it at the bottom? it would be nice to just make a new query object each time but we probably don't want recursion here.. so need some mutation somewhere.
replies.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: that way, I think you can reuse translateRowsToKeyPredicates, although I may be mistaken
replies.author: felixdesouza

timeline.author: felixdesouza

timeline.bodyText: at some point, you want to comment on the optimisation is that you're doing, it's easy to get lost in CassandraKeyValueServiceImpl. If you're able to encode that in your method names, even better, but might make sense to just comment/javadoc.
timeline.author: felixdesouza
sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: Integer.MAX_VALUE for now as we want to maintain the existing behaviour.
replies.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: This method is actually fetching the values as well, not just the cells. I would name it something like getAllCellsForRows
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: as above, I'd prefer get instead of fetch because we are getting the values. Strictly speaking it should be getForCellsForKeyPredicates but I find that a bit clumsy, so would be ok with just changing the first word.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: nit: ... + " cells)"; rather than two separate strings
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: And we probably want a comma before saying the number of cells. The idea is to get something like multiget_multislice(host, table, 1000 cells)
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: Let's move this to the runtime config, so it can be reloaded more easily.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
jeremyk-91
